results.title: The 7.30 Report
results.brief_description: The 7.30 Report was an Australian nightly television current affairs program, that was shown on ABC1 and ABC News 24 at 7.30pm, Mondays–Thursdays.

constellations_other.name: Nightly news and laughs
constellations_other.description: Throughout the decades on Australian screens, comedy and news have often gone hand-in-hand.

results.description:
The 7.30 Report was an Australian nightly television current affairs program, that was shown on ABC1 and ABC News 24 at 7.30pm, Mondays–Thursdays. Its sister program, Stateline was shown at the same time on Friday nights.

In 2011, it was replaced by 7.30, a revamped current affairs program presented by Leigh Sales and Chris Uhlmann.
description_for_label:
The 7.30 Report was an Australian nightly television current affairs program, that was shown on ABC1 and ABC News 24 at 7.30pm, Mondays–Thursdays. Its sister program, Stateline was shown at the same time on Friday nights.

In 2011, it was replaced by 7.30, a revamped current affairs program presented by Leigh Sales and Chris Uhlmann.

results.title: The 'Burbs
results.creator_credit: Imagine Entertainment, Rosanna Norton, Joe Dante, Dana Olsen, James H. Spencer, Larry Brezner and Michael Finnell
results.brief_description: When secretive new neighbors move in next door, suburbanite Ray Peterson and his friends let their paranoia get the best of them as they start to suspect the newcomers of evildoings and commence an investigation. But it’s hardly how Ray, who much prefers drinking beer, reading his newspaper and watching a ball game on the tube expected to spend his vacation.

constellations_other.name: Suburbia and surveillance
constellations_other.description: Tru-Vue and View-Masters allow users to look through view finders and discover new worlds and perspectives, something also explored through many films and TV shows, where watching often reveals secrets, truth and even illusions.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Imagine Entertainment, Rosanna Norton, Joe Dante, Dana Olsen, James H. Spencer, Larry Brezner and Michael Finnell

But it’s hardly how Ray, who much prefers drinking beer, reading his newspaper and watching a ball game on the tube expected to spend his vacation.

results.title: That Thing You Do!
results.creator_credit: Clinica Estetico, Clavius Base, 20th Century Fox, Tom Hanks, Colleen Atwood, Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon and Gary Goetzman
results.brief_description: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.

constellations_other.name: Conflict to cartoons
constellations_other.description: The Bell and Howell Filmo 70DR was a durable, 16mm camera frequently used by combat photographers like Robert Capa during the Spanish Civil War and Australian Neil Davis in the Vietnam War, but this Constellation goes to some much brighter places.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Clinica Estetico, Clavius Base, 20th Century Fox, Tom Hanks, Colleen Atwood, Jonathan Demme, Edward Saxon and Gary Goetzman
results.description: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.
description_for_label: A Pennsylvania band scores a hit in 1964 and rides the star-making machinery as long as it can, with lots of help from its manager.

results.title: Terminator: Dark Fate
results.brief_description: 27 years after the events of Terminator 2: Judgment Day, a new, modified liquid metal Terminator (Gabriel Luna) is sent from the future by Skynet in order to terminate Dani Ramos (Natalia Reyes), a hybrid cyborg human (Mackenzie Davis), and her friends. Sarah Connor comes to their aid, as well as the original Terminator, for a fight for the future.
results.description: 27 years after the events of Terminator 2: Judgment Day, a new, modified liquid metal Terminator (Gabriel Luna) is sent from the future by Skynet in order to terminate Dani Ramos (Natalia Reyes), a hybrid cyborg human (Mackenzie Davis), and her friends. Sarah Connor comes to their aid, as well as the original Terminator, for a fight for the future.

results.title: Ten Canoes
results.brief_description: Filmed in Arnhem Land with a cast of local Indigenous Australians, Ten Canoes interweaves two tales of forbidden love and consequence, spanning thousands of years of Yolngu storytelling, and is told entirely in language.

constellations_other.name: David Gulpilil
constellations_other.description: David Gulpilil is a Yolngu man of the Mandhalpuyngu speech of the Djinba language. As a young boy, Gulpilil was an accomplished hunter, tracker and dancer, which he turned into an acclaimed film career that saw him win the Best Actor award at the Cannes Film Festival (for Charlie's Country) and an AACTA for The Tracker, among his many honours.

results.description:
When legendary actor David Gulpilil and director Rolf de Heer decided to make a film together, Gulpilil proposed a story inspired by the ethnographic images Donald Thomson took around Arnhem Land in the 1930s. One image, reproduced here, shows men canoeing across a swamp and was re-created in the film, like many of Thomson’s photos were. 

Filmed in Arnhem Land with a cast of local Indigenous Australians, Ten Canoes interweaves two tales of forbidden love and consequence, spanning thousands of years of Yolngu storytelling, and is told entirely in language.
description_for_label:
When legendary actor David Gulpilil and director Rolf de Heer decided to make a film together, Gulpilil proposed a story inspired by the ethnographic images Donald Thomson took around Arnhem Land in the 1930s. One image, reproduced here, shows men canoeing across a swamp and was re-created in the film, like many of Thomson’s photos were. 

Filmed in Arnhem Land with a cast of local Indigenous Australians, Ten Canoes interweaves two tales of forbidden love and consequence, spanning thousands of years of Yolngu storytelling, and is told entirely in language.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
results.creator_credit: I.D.D.H., Murakami Wolf Swenson, Fred Wolf Films, Mirage Studios, Surge Licensing, Playmates Toys, Kara Vallow and Andy Luckey
results.brief_description: Distinctly different from the grim, violent, and dark MIRAGE comics from which the Turtles originated, this version of the franchise has remained the longest-running, and most memorable, version of all.

constellations_other.name: News on location
constellations_other.description: The Pye Orthicon is an example of the type of television cameras used from the 1950s in Australia for both studio and outside broadcast work. Such cameras did not have have the capacity to record while out on location and so outside crews would transmit vision and sound back to studios for recording or live broadcast.

results.creator_credit_for_label: I.D.D.H., Murakami Wolf Swenson, Fred Wolf Films, Mirage Studios, Surge Licensing, Playmates Toys, Kara Vallow and Andy Luckey
results.description: Distinctly different from the grim, violent, and dark MIRAGE comics from which the Turtles originated, this version of the franchise has remained the longest running, and most memorable, version of all. Four turtles fall into the sewers and are befriended by Hamato Yoshi a Japanese man sent to New York who was forced to live in the sewers. One day he sees a strange green glow which transforms the four turtles into human-like creatures. Hamato (now Master Splinter) changes into a giant rat from the green glow and teaches the turtles the skills of the ninja as they team up with Channel 6 news reporter April O’Neil to battle against Yoshi’s arch enemy Shredder and Krang, an alien warlord from Dimension X.
description_for_label: Distinctly different from the grim, violent, and dark MIRAGE comics from which the Turtles originated, this version of the franchise has remained the longest running, and most memorable, version of all. Four turtles fall into the sewers and are befriended by Hamato Yoshi a Japanese man sent to New York who was forced to live in the sewers. One day he sees a strange green glow which transforms the four turtles into human-like creatures. Hamato (now Master Splinter) changes into a giant rat from the green glow and teaches the turtles the skills of the ninja as they team up with Channel 6 news reporter April O’Neil to battle against Yoshi’s arch enemy Shredder and Krang, an alien warlord from Dimension X.

results.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
results.headline_credit: Hong Kong and United States of America, 1990
results.brief_description: A quartet of mutated humanoid turtles clash with an uprising criminal gang of ninjas

constellations_other.name: Cartoon classics and criticism
constellations_other.description: A whole cavalcade of cartoons have successfully made the leap into arcades and onto consoles, but the relationship between cinema and videogames is far more likely to fizzle out.

results.headline_credit_for_label: Hong Kong and United States of America, 1990
results.description: A quartet of mutated humanoid turtles clash with an uprising criminal gang of ninjas

results.title: Taxi Driver
results.brief_description: Taxi Driver is one of the most iconic films of the 1970s. The savage story of a social misfit from screenwriter Paul Schrader is powerfully directed by Martin Scorsese, with compelling performances from Robert De Niro, Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

constellations_other.name: Reflecting duality and revealing new realities
constellations_other.description: The Toupie Fantoche relies on four prismatic mirrors to reflect changes in animation states.

constellations_other.name: Colour and creativity
constellations_other.description: From dying film to Technicolor and beyond, creative applications of colour have been part of cinema since its inception.

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

recommendations.quote: De Niro’s Travis Bickle is one of the key figures of American cinema; the passage of his taxi through the grubby, smoky streets of the city – accompanied by the great composer Bernard Herrmann’s final score – are unforgettable.  So are his improvised monologues - "Are you talking to me?”

results.description:
Taxi Driver is one of the most iconic films of the 1970s. The savage story of a social misfit and Vietnam vet is brilliantly explored in Paul Schrader’s potent screenplay and Scorsese’s powerfully physical direction, with compelling performances from Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel. Towering over all is the performance of Robert De Niro, whose obsession with porn and violence lead to the film’s powerful ironic climax.

Robert De Niro’s Travis Bickle is one of the key figures of American cinema; the passage of his taxi through the grubby, smoky streets of the city – accompanied by the great composer Bernard Herrmann’s final score – are unforgettable. So, too, are his improvised monologues in front of a mirror (“Are you talking to me?”).

Like Robert Altman’s Nashville, made the year before, the film alludes to the political assassinations of the 60s while turning the violence in another direction altogether and, like no film before it, explores the world of teenage prostitution – Jodie Foster as a 12-year-old prostitute and Harvey Keitel as her pimp – with an unblinking eye. The New York depicted here evokes the sordid nightmare of Midnight Cowboy rather than the clashing codes of family, religion and criminality Scorsese had explored in Mean Streets. The film’s Cannes Film Festival Palme d’Or confirmed the director’s status as an American master.
description_for_label:
Taxi Driver is one of the most iconic films of the 1970s. The savage story of a social misfit and Vietnam vet is brilliantly explored in Paul Schrader’s potent screenplay and Scorsese’s powerfully physical direction, with compelling performances from Jodie Foster and Harvey Keitel. Towering over all is the performance of Robert De Niro, whose obsession with porn and violence lead to the film’s powerful ironic climax.

Robert De Niro’s Travis Bickle is one of the key figures of American cinema; the passage of his taxi through the grubby, smoky streets of the city – accompanied by the great composer Bernard Herrmann’s final score – are unforgettable. So, too, are his improvised monologues in front of a mirror (“Are you talking to me?”).

Like Robert Altman’s Nashville, made the year before, the film alludes to the political assassinations of the 60s while turning the violence in another direction altogether and, like no film before it, explores the world of teenage prostitution – Jodie Foster as a 12-year-old prostitute and Harvey Keitel as her pimp – with an unblinking eye. The New York depicted here evokes the sordid nightmare of Midnight Cowboy rather than the clashing codes of family, religion and criminality Scorsese had explored in Mean Streets. The film’s Cannes Film Festival Palme d’Or confirmed the director’s status as an American master.

results.title: Taxi
results.brief_description: A yellow cab is driving through the vibrant and colourful streets of Tehran. Very diverse passengers enter the taxi, each candidly expressing their views while being interviewed by the driver who is no one else but the director Jafar Panahi himself. His camera placed on the dashboard of his mobile film studio captures the spirit of Iranian society through this comedic and dramatic drive…

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

results.title: Tangerine
results.brief_description: It’s Christmas Eve in LA and Sin-Dee is back on the block. Hearing that her pimp boyfriend hasn’t been faithful while she was in jail, Sin-Dee and her best friend, Alexandra, embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor.

constellations_other.name: Home movies, fiction and reality blurred
constellations_other.description: The accessibility and portability of cameras has had a big impact on how we see ourselves and the world. As camera technology continues to evolve, so do our ways of seeing, with the line between reality and fiction disappearing.

constellations_other.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_other.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: It’s Christmas Eve in Tinseltown and Sin-Dee is back on the block. Upon hearing that her pimp boyfriend hasn’t been faithful during the 28 days she was locked up, the working girl and her best friend, Alexandra, embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor. Their rip-roaring odyssey leads them through various subcultures of Los Angeles, including an Armenian family dealing with their own repercussions of infidelity.
description_for_label: It’s Christmas Eve in Tinseltown and Sin-Dee is back on the block. Upon hearing that her pimp boyfriend hasn’t been faithful during the 28 days she was locked up, the working girl and her best friend, Alexandra, embark on a mission to get to the bottom of the scandalous rumor. Their rip-roaring odyssey leads them through various subcultures of Los Angeles, including an Armenian family dealing with their own repercussions of infidelity.
